item.title: BI Consultant, Enterprise Data Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics is responsible for establishing data as a strategic asset for CIBC, building out our data and analytics capabilities, and developing an enterprise-wide data enablement strategy. This role is key to deliver and provide expertise on BI & Analytics, data integration as well as UI design techniques. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated individual with knowledge of the technologies that are utilized to support CIBC\'s BI/Analytical standard tools.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • The BI Consultant will design and carry out the development of BI Analytics and data integration leveraging a wide variety of tools connected to multiple data sources, taking into account CIBC processes, methodologies, data flows, system dependencies.
  • You will Provide leadership in designing BI/Analytics development, implementation activities, future roadmap development of the Analytical environments & Analytical tools (Tableau, Alteryx, ThoughtSpot, SQL  etc.)
  • Identify opportunities to automate, streamline processes that will bring in efficiency in reporting and analytical environments, lessen manual intervention and increase end user efficiency.
  • Lead and partner with Business Analytics, Technology, Enterprise Architecture, and other business groups with a focus of fostering BI/Analytics research & innovation culture

What We’re Looking For

  • Practical knowledge and hands on experience in the area of Data Engineering, BI and Data Analytic, Big Data (Hadoop).
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience with Tableau, Alteryx, T-SQL (MS SQL), Python, Hive, Impala. Having exposure to Spark, HTML and Salesforce is an asset.
  • Presentation/interactive/analytical skills sufficient to convey both factual and conceptual information utilizing methodologies as  Rapid BI, Design Thinking and Storytelling.
  • Business analysis and consulting skills to precisely articulate & understand business requirements and ideas that involve interpretation, analysis, assessment and implementation. 
  • Working knowledge of CIBC’s organizational structure, facilities, policies, processes, products and operating procedures, guidelines and systems is preferable. 
  • Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

Who You Are

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-55 Yonge Street, 6th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Technology (Inactive)

item.title: Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – You integrate domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements)
  • Analytics – You identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  You appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  You proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – You leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – You think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Actionable Insights, Advanced Analytics, Big Data, Business Analytics, Business Intelligence (BI), Decision Making, Identifying Opportunities, Presentations, Problem Solving, Process Improvements, Taking Initiative

item.title: Sr. Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, Cards Analytics & Insights the Senior Manager – Cards Analytics & Insights will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting the Cards business within Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – you will combine analytical work with domain knowledge to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth.
  • Analytics – identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends; proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

Toronto-33 Yonge Street, 7th

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

item.title: Senior Manager, Product Analytics Integration and Strategy
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Manager, Product Analytics Integration and Strategy will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science (A&DS) team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The A&DS team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy.  In this role, you will be accountable for leading integrated and strategic across-product analytical engagements, while championing the continued modernization of the Product Analytics team.  This role will report to the Senior Director, Product Analytics.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Strategic Thinking Approach – Think strategically, mobilize and engage teams from across the organization to drive, manage and execute on strategic A&DS Product Analytics team engagements.
  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth.
  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate and influence the adoption of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Business Integration – Lead integrated and strategic A&DS Product Analytics across-team engagements.  Support the Product Analytics leadership to ensure the efficiency and effectiveness of the team. 
  • Communication -  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, processes, and technology solutions to others with different disciplinary backgrounds. Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate command of language, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.
  • Job location is 33 Yonge Street, 7th floor, however, this may change dependent on business need.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Expected End Date

2022-11-18

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Accountable, Advanced Analytics, Alteryx, Analytics Consulting, Big Data, Consulting, Data-Driven Decision Making, IBM Cognos Business Intelligence, Presentations, Product Analytics, Python, Regression Models, SAS System, Strategic Influence, Strategic Thinking, Structured Query Language (SQL), Tableau, Taking Initiative

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Small Business Risk Management, the successful candidate will be well versed in designing, building and implementing account acquisition and account management strategies with a focus on increasing auto-approval rates and decreasing loss rates. Expert level SAS SQL coding skills are required to extract value from data combined with strong communication skills for presentation of risk-reward analysis to Senior Management. Reporting (standard and ad hoc) will require attention to detail and accuracy.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data driven - Actively work with other business partners across the organization to ensure that work is aligned to our mandate and objectives.   Lead and support in-depth client insights studies using SAS, and create an analytical framework to help solve key business questions and test hypotheses. A strong understanding of reporting, analysis and data mining combined with  practical industry experience is required.
  • Continuous improvement mindset - Strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements with the goal of improving efficiencies and synergies between internal and external partners.
  • Communication and relationship management - Lead and assist in preparing comprehensive presentations as needed to highlight key insights from deep dive analysis along with any recommendations that can be adopted to help address gaps or opportunities.  Manage a number of high priority requests to support management in order to support the bank’s strategy. Interact and work effectively across multiple internal teams, and establish a process to facilitate data/information sharing that ensures a consistent, common understanding of key client metrics.
  • Critical thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities.  You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions.  You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion. Openly and frequently share your knowledge, ideas and views because you know your perspective matters.
  • Project execution - Own and lead projects from inception to execution – such as, working with all stakeholders across the organization to develop a holistic client contribution framework & assessment to the automation of the entire process. Stay abreast of industry best practices regarding analytical methods and technologies.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in at least 3-5 years’ experience and strong skills in data extraction/manipulation and statistical analysis tools, including SAS SQL (required); comfort with exploring how new and emerging data can be used; Knowledge of data visualization tools such as COGNOS, Tableau, etc. is an asset. Working in applied data & analytics problems in business banking and/or retail banking is an asset.  Experience creating Access/VBA based reporting databases is an strong asset. Experience is developing business requirements documents and solutions requirements documents with Technology is an asset.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You have a degree/diploma in a relevant bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or quantitative discipline such as Applied Statistics; related banking/business/finance knowledge is considered an asset
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 29th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.

  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).

  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).

  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).

  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.

  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.

What you need to know

item.title: Sr. Finance Data Analyst
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Global Process Owner Accounting (GPO) Team is accountable for working to align all Capital Market (CM) strategic initiatives for people, policies and technologies across geographies with a mindset to optimize processes and eliminate inefficiencies and redundancies. You will be leveraging your data analytics background and tools such as Alteryx, Tableau & DevOps to create workflows and visualizations to help management draw insights and aid in strategic decision making. You will contribute to and lead projects to optimize and simplify processes, working with a variety of internal stakeholders including CM Trading, Technology and Operations as well as numerous groups within Finance.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Relationship management –  possess good teamwork, partnership and relationship building skills sufficient to act in a collaborative manner with team members and stakeholders from different backgrounds and experiences. You will liaise daily with Finance, Front Office and other Capital Markets’ stakeholder groups.
  • Accounting and Controls – draw on your controls & governance skill sets to design and implement processes that result in accurate, complete, and timely inputs used throughout Finance. You take a holistic view of problems end to end and develop deep understanding of the current state so you can recommend ways to do things better. You draw on your past experiences to lead significant break investigations and analysis which is then summarized and presented to key stakeholders.
  • Subject Matter Expertise - Provide subject matter expertise (SME) on business analytics serving as the lead on all reporting / data visualization projects to gather reporting and data visualization requirements and develop user reports and dashboards.
  • Data/Reporting - Deliver key design and solution on reporting and dashboarding projects as well to provide thought leadership on data capture and delivery for the overall project.
  • Advisory - Provide advisory and training to Finance users on the adoption and proper use of the business analytics tools.
  • Agility – drive value by integrating, standardizing and sustaining the processes throughout the CIBC. You will help in eliminating process inefficiencies and creating enterprise-wide changes by developing a good understanding of the current state processes, defining the target state, and helping establishing a plan to streamline.

Who You Are

  • You are an experienced data professional. You have 2 or more years of experience as a dashboarding or reporting specialist and 3 years of relevant industry experience. You have comprehensive knowledge of a number of workflow automation or data visualization tools / platforms with the ability to interpret complex business requirements. Practical DevOps, Alteryx & Tableau experience an asset
  • You can demonstrate experience with a strong Capital Markets accounting background in order to support the oversight and governance functions, including enhancement of financial controls across multiple groups.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You have a degree in Computer Science, Business, Finance or Accounting, a certificate in Data Science, or an equal combination of education and industry experience.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration, and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

18 York Street, 10th floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Alteryx, Azure Devops, Business Analysis, Capital Markets, Tableau

item.title: Senior Developer, Analytics & Automation
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Senior Developer, Analytics & Automation, you will be joining the Internal Audit department and the Data Analytics (DA) team, reporting to the Director, Data Management and Analytics Enablement.  You will be responsible for making complex data more accessible, understandable and usable to our users, as well as creating tools that can help simplify and automate our processes.  Incorporating design thinking, process design and user experience techniques to create intuitive dashboards for our users for insights and analytics

How You’ll Succeed

  • Curious and Creative – we are looking for someone who is curious and creative, someone who is innovative and likes to try new concepts, as well as interpret themes and insights, and design an experience that makes complex insights more intuitive
  • Project Management and Process Design Skills – Our team constantly looks for ways to optimize and streamline processes to enhance efficiencies.  A good understanding in User Interface and User Experience (UI/UX) design is preferred
  • Technical / Data Modelling Skills – prior experience in finding meaningful insights and design intuitive visualizations is beneficial.  A background in web app design, data design, as well as DEV & UAT testing will be an asset
  • Data Management – Assist the director and the analytics team to source and manage new data sources for projects and ongoing audit engagements
  • Stay Current with Best Practices – our team constantly looks for ways to improve user experience and insights consumption, staying up to date with industry best practices in storytelling/data visualization, user experience, machine learning and big data analytics
  • Stay Current with Internal Audit – actively identify current and emerging trends, themes and topics in Internal audit analytics

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in: data management, UI/UX and dashboard design.  Experience in PHP, Django, Python, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Alteryx, Hadoop (Cloudera)
  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field of study. It’s an asset if you have background in graphical design
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Consultant, Business Systems Analysis
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

As a Business Systems Consultant you will be responsible for providing management reporting and business analytics to support IT Senior Management. This includes creating and delivering regular and ad hoc reports as well as conducting analysis to support business decisions and initiatives

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Data Analytics & Reporting: Gather key business metrics that will support management and risk reports on a regular basis. Perform business analysis to support business decisions and initiatives.  Provide Information Governance by maintaining a Metric Dictionary and calendar of key deliverables
  • Understanding and Documenting Requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.
  • Leading and Mentoring – Support technology project implementation as a data subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.

Who You Are

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You\'re driven by collective success and your influence makes an impact. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You have strong business acumen, including 4 to 8 years of working experience, preferably with 2 years of consulting experience. A university degree is required (Engineering, Computer Science or Business preferred) with an MBA being nice to have. A developed working knowledge of the IT industry is essential. Operations Risk experience is an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Toronto-CC East 11th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Agile Methodologies, Change Management, Data Analytics (Inactive), Demonstrating Business Acumen (Inactive), Driving Vision and Purpose (Inactive), ITIL (Inactive), Management Consulting, Managing Relationships (Inactive), Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Word, Problem Solving, Taking a Global Perspective (Inactive)

item.title: Senior Business Analyst
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will provide expert and specialized analytics across all channels and within Retail Transaction Fraud.  You will play a key role in consolidation, reconciliation and automation of operational losses, fraud trends and root cause of loss reporting discrepancies in a defined and short timeframe. You will be a subject matter expert in developing robust methodologies for forecasting operational losses. Utilize creative thinking and apply mathematical, financial and statistical methods in the design/development of new analysis.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytics – Manage complex statistical analysis/analytics and interpret results to determine risk attributes, loss trends, root causes and key drivers of operational losses. Design, development of code and processes to carry out the extraction, manipulation, transformation and delivery of data extracts & data sets in SQL & SAS. Create processes and code to automate delivery of new and existing standard analytics & reporting in SAS, Tableau and Microsoft Office. Deliver moderately complex data quality extract and manipulation reviews using SAS / SQL and deliver feedback to Decision Support on those reviews. Apply creative thinking to overcome limitations in data availability and data quality.
  • Reporting – Design, develop and deliver visual reporting to replace and supplement existing reporting using state of the art visual reporting tools. Provide complex analytical reporting capability to business units based on client requirements combined with a business assessment of each functional unit’s business needs. Develop an operational measurement & reporting plan for new initiatives as well existing business operations processes. Deliver monthly dashboards such as root cause of losses, fraud sustainment, Operational Loss Dashboard, Monthly Business and Partner and Business reviews which provides ability to measure the success of our business and provide insight into how we are losing money.
  • Consulting - Identify emerging risk issues/trends and assess/recommend deficiencies. Develop robust methodologies for forecasting operational losses. Utilize creative thinking and apply mathematical, financial and statistical methods in the design/development of new analysis. Support and sometimes lead project implementation as it relates to new business activities and/or internal initiatives. Identify opportunities for process improvement and recommend solutions. Conduct meetings and presentations to share data, information, findings and expertise on relevant topics with operational & executive leadership as well as frontline and support staff.
  • Relationship Management - Develop and maintain productive relationships with management, peers and others across all lines of business. Liase with Finance and  line of businesses throughout the forecasting process. Provide technical and professional guidance to Business Analysts as needed. Collaborate with the Business Controls and Fraud Effectiveness to improve the quality of meta-data; and the quality of reporting and analytical databases.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with reporting models, databases/ data management and visualization tools, such as SAS, R, Python, SQL, Tableau and VBA (extensive working experience with Tableau and SAS or SAS EG is required, Dashboard building using Tableau, HTML & JavaScript ). You also have a very high level of expertise with Microsoft Office 2010 and Office 2010 automation (Excel & PowerPoint + VBA). Alteryx. Python (Web Data Scrapping)
  • You have a degree/diploma in computer science, mathematics, statistics / similar area or an equivalent combination of training and experience in reporting and software development.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way for business, operations and management to make sound decisions.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Toronto-750 Law Ave. W., E4

Regular

37.5
